image.altText: Aerial view of a smelter facility near a waterway.

props.synopsis: One of the biggest industrial manufacturing employers in Tasmania's north, Liberty Bell Bay, formerly known as TEMCO, is struggling with a lack of ore supply.

title.children: Breaking: Tasmanian smelter and major employer enters 'limited operations'

image.altText: an afl playing field with stands

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government reveals the cost of building a new AFL high-performance centre for the Tasmania Devils has increased from a proposed $70 million to $115 million.

title.children: Devils performance centre cost blows out by $45m, as full project cost yet to be revealed

image.altText: A man with a white beard and hair  wearing a black t-shirt and jeans sits on rocks by the water.

props.synopsis: Independent Tasmanian MP Craig Garland appeared unrepresented in court and was told to seek legal advice before entering a plea next month.

title.children: Tasmanian MP Craig Garland appears in court on drug driving charge

image.altText: A close up of flower buds on a eucalyptus tree.

props.synopsis: Plant scientist Rebecca Jones recommends planting the heat-tolerant Risdon peppermint, which is currently found only on Hobart's eastern shore.

title.children: Rare 'scraggly looking' Tasmanian eucalypt thrives while others die

image.altText: four small fish with a tennis ball for scale

props.synopsis: Seen in their hundreds along rocky foreshores between Taroona and Sandy Bay, the sight of the small pelagic fish in the River Derwent has raised questions about the cause of the mass die-off.

title.children: Masses of small fish washing up in Hobart has locals concerned

image.altText: A doctor is injecting a vaccine to a baby boy

props.synopsis: There have been almost 50,000 cases of RSV recorded this year, but only a select group can access the free vaccine, with other vulnerable Australians needing to fork out hundreds of dollars.

title.children: RSV season is ramping up but only some can access the free vaccine

image.altText: A tank fires a large fiery blast in a field.

props.synopsis: American officials remain privately frustrated over Australia's decision to donate retired Abrams tanks to Ukraine, even as the vehicles finally begin the long sea journey to the battleground.

title.children: US officials question use of Australia's retired tanks as vehicles go to Ukraine

image.altText: Mount Piper power station, near Lithgow, owned by EnergyAustralia

props.synopsis: Energy giant acknowledges "legitimate concerns" in apology over its program spruiking carbon offsetting to thousands of households.

title.children: Energy giant apologises to customers in 'greenwashing' settlement

image.altText: GettyImages-72053108

props.synopsis: A former West Coast Eagles player whose life hit "the tipping point" when he was delisted from the club adds his voice to calls for the AFL to establish a mental health round in the wake of Adam Selwood's death.

title.children: Adam Selwood's death prompts former Eagle to open up on mental health

image.altText: Actor Samuel Johnson

props.synopsis: He has overcome a series of personal tragedies, but Gold Logie winner Samuel Johnson says he is not peddling a redemptive narrative.

title.children: Actor Samuel Johnson felt like a 'turd burger' — until a crash nearly killed him

image.altText: Sussan Ley and David Littleproud

props.synopsis: It does not look feasible for a political party to succeed in Australia without a credible commitment to reducing carbon emissions.

title.children: The Liberals will have to choose between the Nationals and the climate

image.altText: A tank moving through a dusty field on the Gaza border.

props.synopsis: Israel has begun its expansion of its ground offensive in the war-ravaged strip, as Palestinian health authorities say more than 460 people have been killed in the last week.

title.children: Israel's military starts 'extensive' new ground operations in Gaza

image.altText: A woman with dark hair smiles.

props.synopsis: Liberal candidate for Bradfield Gisele Kapterian has increased her lead to 50 votes over her independent rival Nicolette Boele. Follow live.

title.children: Liberals increase lead in Bradfield after absent vote count

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Marles coy on why it took so long for tanks to be sent to Ukraine
Albanese tells Zelenskyy Australia doing 'whatever we can' to pressure on Russia

image.altText: Emergency personal outside a house where a car has been crushed by a fallen tree.

props.synopsis: The SES is urging communities across the Hunter and Mid North Coast to be on alert for flash flooding as heavy rainfall batters the coast.

title.children: Kite surfer blown onto power lines as wind and rain wreak havoc in NSW

image.altText: A blonde woman sits and smiles whilst holding a grey guinea pig

props.synopsis: A tribunal orders a landlord to pay a New South Wales tenant for causing stress, frustration and intimidation. As new rental laws come into effect, tenants' advocates say they don't go far enough.

title.children: Tenant awarded compensation amid calls for bad landlord register

image.altText: A mum holding her two young sons

props.synopsis: Children are waiting months for check-ups with Far North Queensland's only paediatric cardiologist, with the region's rate of childhood rheumatic heart disease 30 times higher than the rest of the state.

title.children: Parents plead for children's 'amazing' heart doctor to get helping hand

image.altText: An image of the Reserve bank sign in Martin Place, Sydney

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has fallen at the open on Monday, as the Reserve Bank's two-day meeting gets underway today ahead of its interest rates decision tomorrow. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: Australian stocks slip ahead of RBA rates decision tomorrow

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill' clears first hurdle, paves way for tax cuts, more spending
Telstra defends network coverage claims after changing website
China's economy slows as trade war takes it toll

image.altText: A rock in sand

props.synopsis: A fireball dubbed the Mother's Day Meteorite has been found in a salt lake in Western Australia by a country police officer and a university team known as the Desert Fireball Network.

title.children: Tennis ball-sized meteorite that lit up WA skies found on salt lake

image.altText: Looking through the windows of St Paul's Anglican Church in Proserpine.

props.synopsis: The Anglican Diocese of North Queensland is on the brink of financial collapse as it struggles to pay millions in compensation to victims of historic child sexual abuse.

title.children: Church on brink of financial collapse following child sexual abuse claims

image.altText: Five men stand in profile, wearing feathered helmets, white ruffs and yellow, blue and red tunics.

props.synopsis: Pope Leo isn't just the leader of the Catholic Church. He's also the head of the Holy See, the central governing body of Vatican City.

title.children: How the Catholic Church ended up with its own sovereign state

image.altText: Debris is scattered outside a parched building

props.synopsis: FBI investigators identify a primary suspect connected to a bombing near a fertility clinic in Palm Springs in California, saying he held "nihilistic ideations".

title.children: FBI links Palm Springs fertility clinic bombing suspect to 'nihilistic ideations'

image.altText: Lando Norris talks to Oscar Piastri

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen overtook Oscar Piastri on the first lap of the Emilia-Romagna Grand Prix and streaked away to win the race, with the Australian left frustrated with third place.

title.children: Piastri bemoans 'a few wrong calls' after Verstappen's stunning move

image.altText: Two players in red, white and black jerseys embrace.

props.synopsis: With several star players sidelined, the Maroons will look to debut three players against the Blues in Origin I.

title.children: Maroons turn to three Origin debutants as Queensland counts the cost of injury

image.altText: A young woman with a buzz cut and nose ring smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: One young Australian says she's developed an "emotional bond" with an AI chatbot after using it for mental health support.

title.children: Young Australians using AI for therapy as subsidised mental health session slashed

image.altText: Close-up shot of man wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The NT government has faced criticism over its move to hand a former gas executive "extraordinary powers" to green-light private development, without publicly recruiting for the "highly-paid" position.

title.children: Closed recruitment of ex-gas boss to 'extraordinary' public job criticised

image.altText: A dingo with a fish in its mouth walks down a bush track.

props.synopsis: A fisherman bitten by a dingo on K'gari (Fraser Island) says the animal swam into knee-deep water to give him a "nip".

title.children: Fisher bitten by dingo says he felt a sharp sting

image.altText: GettyImages-2215786872

props.synopsis: Jon Rahm says he is a "little bit embarrassed" after faltering late in a stunning PGA Championship comeback, as Scottie Scheffler claimed victory.

title.children: 'Tough pill to swallow': Rahm rues missed opportunity as Scheffler claims major

image.altText: Tom Burlinson

props.synopsis: Olympians, actors, models and horse-racing royalty saddle up for the 2025 Tour d'Horse, raising more than $1 million for the KIDS Foundation for trauma survivors.

title.children: 'Man from Snowy River' rides again for star-studded fundraiser

image.altText: A yellow Indycar, on its side with the front wheels broken.

props.synopsis: Former Supercars champion Scott McLaughlin survives a terrifying crash in practice ahead of the Indianapolis 500.

title.children: Former Supercars champ involved in terrifying crash ahead of Indianapolis 500

image.altText: A close-up shot of a dugong in bright blue water, with sunrays dappling on its skin and small yellow fish swimming ahead of it.

props.synopsis: Dugongs in the Exmouth Gulf may be forced to range further for food as an extended marine heatwave wipes out critical seagrass habitats.

title.children: Risk grows for WA's dugongs as marine heatwave continues

image.altText: Man in cap looking at phone.

props.synopsis: More than 60 per cent of rental scams are on social media and a majority of those are created by organised crime groups overseas, a cyber support service says.

title.children: Scammers use social media to connect with people looking for rentals

image.altText: A firefighter using a firehose on a smouldering fire inside a burnt out remnant of a warehouse.

props.synopsis: Ukraine's deputy prime minister accuses Russia of targeting civilians in strikes on a number of cities across the country.

title.children: Ukraine accuses Russia of targeting civilians in 'record' drone attack

image.altText: Two women at a cashier holding clothes

props.synopsis: As Bunbury prepares to host the Matildas and the AFL for the first time, local businesses grapple with reports of rising crime and homelessness in the CBD.

title.children: Debate over homelessness and anti-social behaviour erupts in Bunbury

image.altText: A black-and-white movie still of a male chef and a waitress looking at each other through a restaurant lobster tank.

props.synopsis: The plight of immigrant workers in a divided America forms the backbone of this visceral movie set in the chaos of a New York restaurant kitchen.

title.children: Stress, sex and great food: La Cocina is like a film version of The Bear
